<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/09/west-side-story-after-a-year-of-movie-musical-flops?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Can Steven Spielberg Save the Movie Musical?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/09/west-side-story-after-a-year-of-movie-musical-flops?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Steven Spielberg and West Side story Collage" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/507047a2354e8149898db10eb9eaaca246cf741c-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Amblin/20th Century Studios; Getty Images/Jesse Grant, Hany Rizk, Blank Archives</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"> After a number of movie-musical flops this year, Disney is attempting to give ‘em the ol’ razzle dazzle with its release of <em>West Side Story</em>. The film, a Steven Spielberg-directed reboot of the 1961 classic, will premiere in 2,800 theaters today (and on no streaming platforms) across North America and it’s expected to rake in $10–$15 million in opening weekend ticket sales.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Come for Rita Moreno, stay to save the unfranchised</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a lot <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/box-office/west-side-story-box-office-tracking-1235128252/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">riding</a> on the $100 million movie’s release, considering just how les miserably the musical genre has fared at the box office this year. <em>In The Heights</em> only grossed $11.5 million in its opening weekend (despite its positive reviews) and <em>Dear Evan Hansen </em>brought in $7.4 million (despite its awful reviews).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And let’s not even talk about how </span><span><em>Tick Tick Boom</em></span><span> got more attention as a TikTok sound than as a movie after it only lasted three days in Netflix’s top 10.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>West Side Story</em>’s financial outlook raises another existential question for the industry: Can you make a blockbuster without infinity stones?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After all, <em>Spider-Man: No Way Home</em>’s release next weekend is expected to bring in roughly $150 million. Which means that even if Peter Parker performs on the low end of projections, <em>West Side Story</em> would only bring in about 10% of the new Marvel movie’s revenue.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the revamped 10-time Oscar-winning film has a secret weapon: Spielberg. The Ohio legend has collectively brought in almost <a href="https://www.indiewire.com/2021/12/west-side-story-release-covid-1234684083/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$10 billion</a> with his films domestically. And while the whole concept of the on-screen musical feels a tad cursed at the moment, Spielberg’s bullish on the holiday season: He’s released over one-third of his features around Christmas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>even if the Sharks vs. Jets rumble ends up with the rest of the unimpressive dance numbers of 2021, Disney will probably keep experimenting with musicals. In the crowded streaming market, last year’s <em>Hamilton</em> release on Disney+ spiked app downloads 74% in July.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Starbucks-workers-vote-yes-form-union?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Starbucks Workers in Buffalo Voted For a Union
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/Starbucks-workers-vote-yes-form-union?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="A general view of a Starbucks store on December 9, 2021 in Buffalo, New York." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/858770f14eb6859b5ee1a946c391b267b469fd33-1024x768.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>ELEONORE SENS/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starbucks workers in Buffalo have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/votes-to-be-counted-in-starbucks-union-drive-11639071187?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voted yes to forming a union</a>—the first of its kind among the chain’s 9,000 corporate-owned stores in the country. It’s a major victory for labor organizing efforts that have been supercharged by the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) counted ballots from three Buffalo-area Starbucks stores on Thursday. Of the three locations, one voted 19–8 to unionize, a second voted 12–8 against, and a third voted 15–9 to form a union, but challenges to ballots will need to be resolved before a final outcome is determined.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Workers United, the union some Starbucks workers will now join, plans to object to the election that the union lost. Plus, the NLRB needs to certify the results, a process that takes about a week.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>According to the Labor Department, less than 2% of food-service and bar workers belonged to a union last year, but the successful unionization of massive chain restaurants like Starbucks could change that. Three more Starbucks stores in Buffalo and a store in Arizona have also filed petitions with the NLRB to hold union elections.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/New-Zealand-law-banning-young-people-buying-cigarettes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
You Shall Not Smoke
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/New-Zealand-law-banning-young-people-buying-cigarettes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Gandalf smokes a pipe in 'The Lord of the Rings' franchise" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b4c934957a001cbd80d7ef8583cec54f4e17769c-1920x1287.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>MGM/New Line Cinema</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new law announced Thursday in New Zealand would <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/09/world/asia/new-zealand-smoking-ban.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ban anyone born after 2008</a> from ever purchasing cigarettes in the country. So the kids hanging out behind the gas station will have to what—talk to each other?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The law, which is expected to pass in 2023, would raise the legal smoking age (currently 18) by one additional year every year, beginning in 2027. So: New Zealanders 14 and under in 2023 will always be younger than the legal limit, while current smokers (and those older than 14 in 2023) will always be permitted to buy cigarettes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New Zealand has been trying to stub out smoking for a minute. In 2011, the country announced a goal of reducing the smoking rate in the country to 5% by 2025, and experts believe Thursday’s announcement may keep them on track.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Around 9.4% of New Zealanders smoke, down from 18% in 2008.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The rate among the Indigenous Maori population is significantly higher, at 31%.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An average pack of cigarettes in NZ costs about $22.50 USD.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">An anti-puffing nation:</strong> In 2020, New Zealanders narrowly voted against legalizing marijuana.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Glad you asked, Mr. Shakespeare. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For instance, you could be what the Fool calls a HENRY: High Earner, Not Rich Yet, that is. If despite earning a great income, you’re still struggling to cultivate a meaningful nest egg, know that since 1993, The Motley Fool has been providing investment guidance to help members build their envisioned financial futures.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Top picks shared with their members include AOL in 1994, Amazon in 1997, and Netflix in 2004.</strong> Yes folks, the early bird does in fact get the worm. And in these cases, that worm was a chonker.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/09/key-performance-indicators-december-10?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/09/key-performance-indicators-december-10?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="BTS tweet speaking out against anti-Asian hate " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fe380f75c3ce460ed6deb18f1c14d3e9f2e3bf3d-529x506.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>This <a href="https://twitter.com/BTS_twt/status/1376712834269159425?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">post</a> from BTS was the most retweeted tweet in 2021, Twitter said. The K-pop group was speaking out against the rise of anti-Asian violence following the March killing of eight people in Georgia, six of whom were Asian women. #BTS was also the top hashtag of the year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The data we’re seeing is largely pointing in the wrong direction.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden sees a bear market for democracies, and he <a href="https://apnews.com/article/white-house-summit-for-democracy-biden-us-1c74e38acbd8ab68ed97aa3354af7b1d?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">convened leaders</a> from more than 100 countries around the globe to discuss ways to confront the rising threats to democratic institutions. China and Russia were not invited to the summit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> Eating at the worst Michelin-starred restaurant, ever. color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCan Steven Spielberg Save the Movie Musical?\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/09/west-side-story-after-a-year-of-movie-musical-flops?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Steven Spielberg and West Side story Collage\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/507047a2354e8149898db10eb9eaaca246cf741c-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDianna \"Mick\" McDougall; Amblin/20th Century Studios; Getty Images/Jesse Grant, Hany Rizk, Blank Archives\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e After a number of movie-musical flops this year, Disney is attempting to give ‘em the ol’ razzle dazzle with its release of \u003cem\u003eWest Side Story\u003c/em\u003e. The film, a Steven Spielberg-directed reboot of the 1961 classic, will premiere in 2,800 theaters today (and on no streaming platforms) across North America and it’s expected to rake in $10–$15 million in opening weekend ticket sales.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCome for Rita Moreno, stay to save the unfranchised\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s a lot \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/film/box-office/west-side-story-box-office-tracking-1235128252/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eriding\u003c/a\u003e on the $100 million movie’s release, considering just how les miserably the musical genre has fared at the box office this year. \u003cem\u003eIn The Heights\u003c/em\u003e only grossed $11.5 million in its opening weekend (despite its positive reviews) and \u003cem\u003eDear Evan Hansen \u003c/em\u003ebrought in $7.4 million (despite its awful reviews).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd let’s not even talk about how \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eTick Tick Boom\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e got more attention as a TikTok sound than as a movie after it only lasted three days in Netflix’s top 10.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWest Side Story\u003c/em\u003e’s financial outlook raises another existential question for the industry: Can you make a blockbuster without infinity stones?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter all, \u003cem\u003eSpider-Man: No Way Home\u003c/em\u003e’s release next weekend is expected to bring in roughly $150 million. Which means that even if Peter Parker performs on the low end of projections, \u003cem\u003eWest Side Story\u003c/em\u003e would only bring in about 10% of the new Marvel movie’s revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the revamped 10-time Oscar-winning film has a secret weapon: Spielberg. The Ohio legend has collectively brought in almost \u003ca href=\"https://www.indiewire.com/2021/12/west-side-story-release-covid-1234684083/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$10 billion\u003c/a\u003e with his films domestically. And while the whole concept of the on-screen musical feels a tad cursed at the moment, Spielberg’s bullish on the holiday season: He’s released over one-third of his features around Christmas. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eeven if the Sharks vs. Jets rumble ends up with the rest of the unimpressive dance numbers of 2021, Disney will probably keep experimenting with musicals. In the crowded streaming market, last year’s \u003cem\u003eHamilton\u003c/em\u003e release on Disney+ spiked app downloads 74% in July.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eELEONORE SENS/AFP via Getty collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarbucks workers in Buffalo have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/votes-to-be-counted-in-starbucks-union-drive-11639071187?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evoted yes to forming a union\u003c/a\u003e—the first of its kind among the chain’s 9,000 corporate-owned stores in the country. It’s a major victory for labor organizing efforts that have been supercharged by the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) counted ballots from three Buffalo-area Starbucks stores on Thursday. Of the three locations, one voted 19–8 to unionize, a second voted 12–8 against, and a third voted 15–9 to form a union, but challenges to ballots will need to be resolved before a final outcome is determined.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWorkers United, the union some Starbucks workers will now join, plans to object to the election that the union lost. Plus, the NLRB needs to certify the results, a process that takes about a week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAccording to the Labor Department, less than 2% of food-service and bar workers belonged to a union last year, but the successful unionization of massive chain restaurants like Starbucks could change that. Three more Starbucks stores in Buffalo and a store in Arizona have also filed petitions with the NLRB to hold union elections.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Gandalf smokes a pipe in 'The Lord of the Rings' franchise\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b4c934957a001cbd80d7ef8583cec54f4e17769c-1920x1287.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMGM/New Line Cinema\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA new law announced Thursday in New Zealand would \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/09/world/asia/new-zealand-smoking-ban.html?partner=slack\u0026smid=sl-share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eban anyone born after 2008\u003c/a\u003e from ever purchasing cigarettes in the country. So the kids hanging out behind the gas station will have to what—talk to each other?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe law, which is expected to pass in 2023, would raise the legal smoking age (currently 18) by one additional year every year, beginning in 2027. So: New Zealanders 14 and under in 2023 will always be younger than the legal limit, while current smokers (and those older than 14 in 2023) will always be permitted to buy cigarettes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew Zealand has been trying to stub out smoking for a minute. In 2011, the country announced a goal of reducing the smoking rate in the country to 5% by 2025, and experts believe Thursday’s announcement may keep them on track.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAround 9.4% of New Zealanders smoke, down from 18% in 2008.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe rate among the Indigenous Maori population is significantly higher, at 31%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAn average pack of cigarettes in NZ costs about $22.50 USD.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAn anti-puffing nation:\u003c/strong\u003e In 2020, New Zealanders narrowly voted against legalizing marijuana.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
